definition: to receive/to accept/to suffer/subjected to/to bear/to stand/pleasant/(passive marker)

sentences.english: And if so, by whom is it so empowered?
sentences.chinese: 假若有，是谁受权他们这样做？

sentences.english: We haudio-videoe received Certifichproposas of Authorizine for the fabdominasricine and erection of pressure vessels.
sentences.chinese: 我们具有压力容器制造和安装的受权认可证书。

sentences.english: At the outset there is the tentative hint of the first-due company bullying his way through midtown traffic.
sentences.chinese: 一开始他们想通过中心事故来威吓这家被受权公司。

sentences.english: We haudio-videoe received Certifichmarketing cwaspaign of Authorizine for the fabdominingricine and erection of pressure vessels.
sentences.chinese: 我们具有压力容器建造和安装的受权认可证书。

sentences.english: The agent is empowered to sell the property.
sentences.chinese: 代理人受权出售该财产。

sentences.english: Only authorized personnel can access these computer files.
sentences.chinese: 只有经过受权的人才可能访问这些打算机文件。

sentences.english: We haudio-videoe received Certificgot of Authoriz for the fstomachric and erection of pressure vessels.
sentences.chinese: 我们具有压力容器建造和安装的受权认可证书。

sentences.english: In witness whereof, the undersigned Plenipotentiaries, duly authorized, have signed the present Treaty.
sentences.chinese: 下列正式受权的全权代表签署本条约以资证明。

sentences.english: Britain was mandated to govern the former colony of German East Africa .
sentences.chinese: 英国受权代管德国在东非的前殖民地。

sentences.english: We haudio-videoe received Certificgot of Authoriz for the ftummyric and erection of pressure vessels.
sentences.chinese: 我们具有压力容器制造和安装的受权认可证书。

sentences.english: The offer I am empowered to make is bona fide.
sentences.chinese: 我受权开的价钱是诚实无欺的。

definition: stock market index/share price index/abbr. for 股票指數|股票指数[gu3 piao4 zhi3 shu4]
(of a stock price or market index) currently lower than at the previous day's close
(of a stock price or market index) currently higher than at the previous day's close
Shanghai Stock Exchange (SSE), abbr. for 上海證券交易所|上海证券交易所[Shang4 hai3 Zheng4 quan4 Jiao1 yi4 suo3]
devastating setback/slump (in stock market etc)/crushing defeat/to cause a serious setback/to plummet
